website_summaries.verdict: With excellent safety, convenience, and comfort features, this changing pad is a great buy whether you're on a budget or not.
pros: Firm and supportive with plenty of cushioning for comfort
Reinforced quilted vinyl cover repels moisture and is easy to wipe clean
Safety belt features an easy-to-use quick release clasp
Non-slip rubber base helps to prevent shifting
cons: Some owners notice a faint plastic smell upon opening

customer_reviews.title: This has little holes it it and gets moldy if ...
customer_reviews.text: This has little holes it it and gets moldy if little one has an accident on it!!!!! The holes are not a defect! This is just the way it's manufactured! Do not buy. Even if you clean the accident immediately, liquid leaks in and you cannot get it out. Thus...the mold.
customer_reviews.author: Thok

customer_reviews.title: One of the essentials
customer_reviews.text: This changing pad was one of my first purchases when I found out I was pregnant. A year later it has become one of our most used items. I personally wish I didn’t buy a changing table and just went with this. I do wish it had a cover on it that was machine washable as all you can do it wipe down. Overall would definitely recommend the purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Dee Gutierrez

customer_reviews.title: Not happy with the quilted holes
customer_reviews.text: Two weeks in as a new parent and maybe I'm missing a step, but the quilted holes get filled with pee and poop and it stains. Yes you can easily wipe up and sanitize, but the stain still remains. This makes it look dirty and unsightly. Will be looking for a new one without the quilted holes and possibly protect it more with covers and deal with more laundry.
customer_reviews.author: AP

customer_reviews.title: difficult to clean
customer_reviews.text: I know I should have put a change cloth down on it every time but sometimes you are in a rush and you don't grab one. There are so many breathing holes on the mat that when I did get something (poop/pee) on it it would be impossible to get it off because it would just smear into the inside foam and it got to the point where it was soaking wet because I would scrub it so much that it wasn't drying and it made it so bad that I just threw it away, next time I'll get one without the breathing holes.
customer_reviews.author: Alexandra Nelson

customer_reviews.title: Not Waterproof - Pee is absorbed into the quilting
customer_reviews.text: NOT Waterproof! The pee will NOT stay on the surface of the pad, rather it will sink INTO the quilting holes. Impossible to clean the stains as the pee is stuck underneath the surface in the foam.
customer_reviews.author: Susie

customer_reviews.title: Does not measure accurately to fit a standard changing table
customer_reviews.text: I really like the material and feel of this changing pad, very soft yet durable and easy to clean. My biggest knock is that I measured my changing table, which is a standard size changing table (16x32) and this pad is allegedly measured the same. Upon arrival, I was dismayed to find this indeed does not fit 16x32, more like 16x30. There is a gap between the pad and the table and it’s really irritating. I have a soft baby blanket to use as a filler in the meantime but it was not what I was expecting. Major heads up! I do, though, love the contoured sides.
customer_reviews.author: Gabs

customer_reviews.title: Gets the job done at half the price!
customer_reviews.text: I’ve had this changing pad for almost two years now! And in fact i recently purchased a second one for my second child‘S room since my first child is still in diapers. What I love about this is that it’s big enough for toddlers as well, it’s easy to clean if anything leaks through, has yet to stain and comes with a “seat belt” as I tell my toddler. The bottom not having adhesion isn’t a problem for us because we just threw a piece of the rubbery drawer liner underneath it and it never moves unless we love it. Honestly, no need to spend $$$ on those expensive changing pads this does the same thing for much, much less.
customer_reviews.author: MssyNorX

customer_reviews.title: Great changing pad
customer_reviews.text: We were previously using a towel taped to a desk so anything is an upgrade. It’s a pretty standard changing pad, easy enough to clean, but I put a cover over it to throw in the wash for the inevitable. I’ve asked for the expert’s opinion, but the baby hasn’t said a word of negativity about it. Come to think of it, she hasn’t said anything positive either. I’m sure once she learns to speak, her first words will be about this changing pad and I can update my review.
customer_reviews.author: customer

customer_reviews.title: Not technically waterproof!
customer_reviews.text: Looks nice and the edges are convenient to keep a rolling baby at Bay along with the straps. Keep in mind your little man can still go over and out just not too easily. Looks nice but the whole reason I bought it was because it said it was waterproof and I had an issue with my son either every diaper change or we going around and just getting stuff everywhere. Needless to say it gets stuck in the little breathing holes and smells awful. It needs to be soaked in vinegar and scrub down to clean. So it doesn't get on the inside material just under the little breathing holes. WILL NOT buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Summer P.

customer_reviews.title: Fantasic Product
customer_reviews.text: I have had children in diapers for over 12 years and go through many of these changing pads. They are large enough for a BIG toddler (42#). I put the pad in the floor to give some cushion when I am changing my kiddo. I will have to say they tend to absorb diarrhea. I usually keep the pad covered with an old towel or baby blanket. Recently my guy had a nasty stomach bug. A few times the stool got onto the actual pad. It looked like it was adsorbed, so I chucked the pad and ordered a new one. Keeping a water proof pad under the cover is ideal.
customer_reviews.author: mdodd

customer_reviews.title: this is what is does for you
customer_reviews.text: Our baby learned to roll over between 4 and 5 months old. We are new parents. I hadn't really considered the height he was off the floor when we are changing his diaper until I saw him roll over. He was on the floor doing tummy time, but once I saw him roll, I thought having him up on the table was a bit more risky than before. So the changing pad thing is good, at least for now, because he isn't able to roll while he is in it. We put one of those huge diaper pad / doggie sort of pad things over it for extra absorption. The kind with the adhesive on the border.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Grandma's house
customer_reviews.text: After reading the reviews on several changing pads, I decided on this one for my grandson's room at our house. It's perfect. I added small Velcro pads to the bottom of the changing pad to keep it from sliding around on the changing table. The Velcro doesn't interfere with changing the covers as needed. Some reviewers complained that it wasn't 100 per cent moisture proof. I use a small waterproof changing pad on top of the little cover that I made...no worries about staining the changing pad. I use a waterproof pad on his waterproof crib mattress as well. I'd rather wash the little pads than wash sheets or staining the changing pad or mattress.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Endures abuse and hundreds of diaper changes with no ripping, sagging, or other issues
customer_reviews.text: I have three of these stationed at various locations in my house to handle multiple children in diapers. The first was purchased over two years ago, and it is still going strong - no problems with sagging, ripping, or other issues - and one of the users is a 30 lb two year old. I wouldn't trust it to secure a wiggly child, but the sides definitely do help to keep small ones in place as diaper changes are in progress. For the price, I think this is one of the more economical pads out there that gets the job done and will provide steady service until your little one is out of diapers.
customer_reviews.author: Seek Felicity

customer_reviews.title: Great Value
customer_reviews.text: We've been using this for over a year and have found no significant fault with it. We never attached it to the wall, but did not leave child unattended once they were able to roll over. Pros: Easy to clean - we rarely let anything get to the actual mat between an absorbent pad and a cover, but it does wipe clean & dries quickly Raised sides keep young infants securely contained, without getting in the way of changing the diaper Cons: Not the easiest to transport if looking for something you want to move around the house with you. For a stationery changing pad this worked great.
customer_reviews.author: Emily Igawa

customer_reviews.title: Baby seems to find it comfortable, but you'll still want a changing cover
customer_reviews.text: The shape and size are just right. Out baby is still too small to need the straps, and we mounted it ourselves rather than using the screw and tab that come with, so I can't evaluate those aspects. I was a little disappointed to find that if poop gets directly on the pad, it will stain because you can't quite wipe out the little holes that cover the surface. This isn't a huge deal, but it seems like a design flaw, so I'm docking it a star.
customer_reviews.author: David Moore

customer_reviews.title: Bigger than I thought, but is big really bad?
customer_reviews.text: I purchased with the TILLYOU Jersey Knit Ultra Soft Changing Pad Cover Set-Cradle Sheet Unisex Change Table Sheets for Baby Girls and Boys-Fit 32"/34'' x 16" Pad-Comfortable Cozy -2 Pack, Navy Blue & Lt Green sheets and they fir perfect!
customer_reviews.author: Jchuk16

customer_reviews.title: Great changing pad!
customer_reviews.text: We already have a Serta changing pad that we love, but wanted another to keep on a different level of our home. I quickly found this one online and the reviews looked good. I'm happy to report that it is working great! Possibly not as lush as the Serta changing pad, but - honestly - as squirmy as our 9-month-old is, that is of very little concern. It is a great quality and easy to clean (though we keep the changing pad covers on it for easy "cleaning" :)). I would definitely recommend this changing pad for your baby!
customer_reviews.author: jordan

customer_reviews.title: DON'T BUY!  UNLESS YOU WANT TO CONSTANTLY SCRUB POOP!
customer_reviews.text: Very soft and worked well for my little baby. Now that he's a little older and having huge blowouts I cannot get this clean. I wipe it down with a clorax wipe, I scrub with oxi clean.. and still can't get poop out of quilted areas. I've worked in day care for several years before and used to cleaning big poops. It shouldn't be this difficult to clean up afterwards. Disappointed because other than the pad being little longer than I wanted I like it. Buying something else that will actually clean. DON'T BUY! UNLESS YOU WANT TO CONSTANTLY SCRUB POOP!
customer_reviews.author: mistaylor

customer_reviews.title: love this probuct.
customer_reviews.text: i love this probuct and so does my baby. even though i had to cut the changing bad off only bacause my changing table is too small for a standard changing pad. (not the makers of the changing pads fault. its the makes of the crib and changing table fault) I love how its water resistant so every time it gets massy i just wipe it down. I also love that the sides come up a bit along with the safty belt so its less likely for baby to roll off.
customer_reviews.author: ashly huemoeller

customer_reviews.title: Waste of Money!
customer_reviews.text: It starts out fine, nothing amazing, just a changing pad. The padding is on the medium, not super cushioned or anything. But with time it gets worse and worse until it's absolutely flat! I am expecting my second and I will need to buy a new pad because this one is soooo worn out! There is no longevity to this pad! I wouldn't bother donating it or anything since it's useless, I might as well just put a towel down for all the cushion it gives.
customer_reviews.author: Jeremy O Bottleson

customer_reviews.title: Durable, comfortable, works
customer_reviews.text: We've used this mat for 3 years with two babies. It's perfect for us. We have a changing table upstairs and use this changing mat downstairs since its super mobile. We hust store it under a table and pull it out as needed. Cleaning isn't hard like others are saying.nif there is a blowout, just use a bleach cleaner. A bonus for us is for some reason when our babies got fussy they calmed down laying on this mat.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: A must-have baby item!
customer_reviews.text: We now have 3 of these!! We had one upstairs and downstairs for my daughter, and when my son was born we got a third for his room. The changing table is well-made, durable, and sturdy for when baby gets older. The foam inside is very thick and dense, so I imagine it is really comfortable for the little ones. The vinyl material wipes clean very easily, and our two older pads basically look new after two years. Instead of using the screws and straps that came with it to attach it to a dresser or table, we just used four pieces of extra strength Velcro and that did the trick. This is a no-brainier purchase in my opinion!
customer_reviews.author: MrsOliva

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed, not as expected from description
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for a changing pad that would be easy to clean and have a non-slip surface to sit on top of our dresser as a make shift changing stand. The 'non-slip' surface on the bottom slides very easily across multiple surfaces that I have used it on, including a bed. You are able to wipe down the material that covers the pad, however, it is covered with tiny holes that are difficult to clean when wet diapers, etc leak.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Non-slip material is too good.
customer_reviews.text: Perfect size for the top of a dresser! Our changing pad covers fit without issues. However the non-slip material on the bottom is perhaps a little *too* good. The first couple of times I peeled it off the top of the dresser to change the cover, it pulled some of the dresser paint off too. It’s upsetting, but the changing pad covers the damage, so I guess it’s not much of an issue.
customer_reviews.author: Jessie Gull

customer_reviews.title: Not 100% water proof
customer_reviews.text: This changing pad is not 100% water proof. The material is a porous diamond pattern that is perforated. If your child has a decent accident on this whether it be urine or feces it will soak in to the pad making it impossible to clean and un sanitary to keep using. I use cotton changing pad covers but I also have to use a waterproof changing pad on top of the covers to prevent accidents from soaking in to the changing pad. Kind of disappointing that you have to cover up the cute covers you can buy for these...
customer_reviews.author: Rozalin

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: If you’re wondering what’s the difference between the Munchkin brand changing pad sold at Target for $30, there is none other than the nonslip grip on the bottom - we will get creative and put some duct tape down or something to avoid slip. We saved our first changing pad covers from our Munchin pad we threw away after our first child, and ordered this brand to save $10 and the target covera fit perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Very durable!
customer_reviews.text: We have used this for almost a year and still looks new, we always had a baby pad and a cover on it so that helped. It’s surely a necessity and a good value as we use it atleast 4 - 6 times a day. Initially this pad helped our baby to calm down and now that she has grown up a bit doesn’t want to stay on it for a min to let us change her, anyway that’s not product issue :)
customer_reviews.author: Mohan

customer_reviews.title: Meh.
customer_reviews.text: I wouldn’t have ordered it if I knew it had a little design on it. We use a cover but it for any reason it is in the washing machine and then we change baby on the mat without a cover it can be really hard to clean. If anything gets into the small design it’s almost impossible to get it out. I would highly recommend getting the one at target that is just flat and smooth with no design.
customer_reviews.author: Amanda

customer_reviews.title: Perfect!
customer_reviews.text: I love this changing pad! The contour adds safety for my newborn! It is easy to clean with just a wet cloth when it gets soiled. It is not too soft as according to the doctor baby need firm support. I bought some changing pad pads to use with this as having to take the cover off all the time got old. I just put a cotton pad down and it is so easy to change our baby and I do not feel like I have to keep my hand on him the entire time if I need to grab a diaper or wipes.
customer_reviews.author: Craig

customer_reviews.title: Recommended with Reservations
customer_reviews.text: Purchased to go along with the "Delta Children Eclipse Changing Table, Espresso Cherry" per "Frequently Bought Together" suggestion list Amazon generates. However, I was disappointed to find that the pad was 2-3" shorter than the table length, which left a gap. While I wasn't pleased with this, it was not a deal breaker. The pad seems to be made well. However, the foam is cheaper quality; the type that quickly breaks down and does not bounce back. Not worth it to return, but would only would recommend this product with reservation.
customer_reviews.author: Dorothy of Oz

customer_reviews.title: Are you paying for reviews?
customer_reviews.text: Purchased over a more expensive option because of the reviews. When the box arrived I didn’t even need to open to know it was paper thin. I did open just to check and yup was like 1/2 and inch thick and the padding like other reviewers stated was bubbles up. It was so tiny that my cover didn’t even fit. Definitely get what you pay for.
customer_reviews.author: CSayers

customer_reviews.title: A month of use
customer_reviews.text: So I couldnt use a sheet for my infant boy because I would be changing it every diaper change 😅 so I had to use just the pad. It stains so easily and a baby wipe does not clean it. I literally wiped my hand across it and it was disgusting and smelt of piss. I used baking soda and vinegar to clean it and now it smells like baking soda and piss.
customer_reviews.author: Caroline

customer_reviews.title: I wish I had thought this through...
customer_reviews.text: I haven't used since baby arrived, I ended up ordering a rubber changing pad. Any time you can save not doing laundry you don't need to is totally worth it, you can be spending that time with your little one!! The return window has closed, so I'll just end up giving it away, bummer.
customer_reviews.author: Joshua Lacheney

customer_reviews.title: Good cheap changing pad
customer_reviews.text: Haven’t gotten to use this product yet so this review is based off just receiving it/ first impression. Changing pad seems a bit thinner than I expected but I don’t think it’ll be an issue. Material is nice and will definitely wipe clean easily. The only complaint I have is the bottom isn’t as “grip-y” as I’d like so it slides around on top of dresser... this can easily be fixed with some double sided Velcro or something along that line so I’m not worried. Overall good material and quality.
customer_reviews.author: AlexBren

customer_reviews.title: Poop stays in the holes! EW!
customer_reviews.text: The size and contour are great, but the huge problem with this pad is that the "quilting" of the vinyl means that there are lots of little holes everywhere. And "IF" (meaning WHEN--think of the purpose of the product) poop gets on the pad, it immediately gets into the holes, and won't come out. I wanted to just be able to wipe it off with a wipe, and call it good, but it doesn't work. The poop gets in the holes and stays there, even after fairly rough scrubbing. EW!
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great product, even better price
customer_reviews.text: Soft, safe, durable, inexpensive. Everything you need in a changing pad. It is the exact same as the one you’d ‘buy buy’ from the baby store for over double the price. All Crib sheets so far have great over it also. (Bought from different places and different brands). The pad also comes with small non skid dots on the bottom to prevent it sliding if placed directly onto the dresser. No complaints what so ever!
customer_reviews.author: Selby441

customer_reviews.title: Does it's job, but only so-so.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my first child, the belt ripped off almost immediately. Even though the belt ripped off, we continued to use the changing pad through the second child since it is easy to clean up if your baby pees in the middle of a diaper change. After 2 children, it's pretty much set to be retired to the trashcan. Pros: Super inexpensive Plastic cover so it's easy to clean Lightweight Cons: The belt ripped off, because the plastic covering tears easily. Because the belt tore off, I was able to see the base is cardboard, and not heavy duty cardboard.
customer_reviews.author: Larson

customer_reviews.title: Pretty good changing pad
customer_reviews.text: This product comes in a bag, which can expose it to 'accidents', like a blade cutting it. When we got ours in, it looked like someone had briefly cut the material. Not a big deal, but that is also the reason why I can't give it a true 5 stars. It should have a bit stronger packaging, like a box, to prevent damage to product. Overall, the product itself seems to work pretty well. Can screw into the table to make sure baby doesn't fly away. Other than that, baby is comfortable. Baby happy = Papa happy
customer_reviews.author: A. Gabel

customer_reviews.title: This is a perfectly fine changing pad
customer_reviews.text: This is a perfectly fine changing pad. My only issue with it is that there are tiny indents all over the pad forming a design. We don't usually have a fabric cover over the pad (because my son is always peeing on it when we change his diaper) and we had a blowout diaper the other day. It was a mess and the little indents were impossible to clean. We needed to use a toothpick to clean out the poop from them. We definitely learned the benefit of having a cover over it. Other than that it has worked fine for our needs.
customer_reviews.author: MisterMagellan

customer_reviews.title: Not non-skid!
customer_reviews.text: I was planning on using this on top of a dresser. The description says it has a non-skid bottom so I figured it would work. But I think that is an inaccurate description. I put it on the dresser before putting any kind of changing pad cover on it and it was not stable, slid very easily. I would not feel comfortable changing my baby on this. I ended up returning it and buying something else.
customer_reviews.author: Anne

customer_reviews.title: Does not fit my Delta Changing Table well
customer_reviews.text: This is a good product but it doesn't fit my Delta Children's Changing Table well at all. It seems too wide to lay flat and not long enough to cover the entire length of the top. Also, since the table already has a safety latch, the extra ends on the changing pad cause too much bulk under the pad causing it not to lay completely flat. I used this same product a few years ago by itself on top of a dresser and it was perfect. I recommend using it for a flat open surface where you don't have to squeeze it into a certain space.
customer_reviews.author: Crystal Goeddel

customer_reviews.title: Great design, fits standard changing tables and changing pad covers
customer_reviews.text: I had this on my registry and bought it myself because I needed a second changing pad for the additional changing table I have in my bedroom. After reading reviews, I was worried that it might be too big but when it arrived it was the perfect size. The material appears to be waterproof and has a bit of give so it doesn't seem uncomfortable for the baby. I like the two sided raised contour design versus the full four sided raised design. Can't wait for my baby to come soon to use it! Also, it fits standard changing pad covers snugly!
customer_reviews.author: Jenn

customer_reviews.title: Cheapest one I could find and good quality
customer_reviews.text: Pretty standard for a changing pad, the material feels strong and sturdy so it will last. It fits perfect with covers I’ve bought online. I don’t know why some other changing pads are so much pricier, this one will do the job just fine and comes with the buckle on it too. I don’t have a changing table I planned on just using this throughout the house to protect my bed and other surfaces from possible poopsplosions so I don’t know how the fit is on a changing table.
customer_reviews.author: Ana

customer_reviews.title: Flawed design, do not reccomend
customer_reviews.text: Well this pad works alright but as the other reviews state, it is not water resistant or easy to clean. Things get caught in and soak into the tiny holes, I have no idea why it has the tiny holes, terrible design flaw! I even use this with a cover but things still soak in, I will be looking for one without holes!
customer_reviews.author: Laura

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable, Safe and Easy to Clean.
customer_reviews.text: I have one at home and bought this one for my best friend to leave at her restaurant since I always take my baby to eat there. Thought having a curved changing pad on top of the changing table will be more comfortable and safer. It’s easy to clean! Her customers also liked it since the pad has been add on.
customer_reviews.author: XXC

customer_reviews.title: Looks perfect to me and fits my cover
customer_reviews.text: Now that it's here, I am so HAPPY! I Had a hard time getting it to me thanks to fed ex and their notorious screw ups, but Amazon came through as always and made sure I got serviced by the pros the 2nd attempt (UPS) and made everything right by giving me a gift card for all the hassle. I am also thrilled I saved money picking the "open box, very good" instead of paying full price..it's in immaculate condition.
customer_reviews.author: Chezby

customer_reviews.title: Looks like a great changing pad
customer_reviews.text: I compared the size of this product to the one I already own, and it appeared they should be the same size, 16x32, so I was assuming all of my changing pad covers would work on this. Not the case, it seems to be a couple inches longer and my PB changing pad covers do not fit this thing, when they are designed for a 16x32 pad... I haven't pulled a tape measure out to see which one lies about the size, but I'm guessing it's this one since it is the odd one out. Looks like a great changing pad, but disappointed about the size discrepancy.
customer_reviews.author: Jarah Hauger

customer_reviews.title: Great Changing Pad
customer_reviews.text: This changing pad fit our needs perfectly. It is a sturdy changing pad and isn't super bulky. The only downfall was the packaging that it came in. It was obnoxiously large for the actual size of the changing pad. It is moisture resistant and easy to clean. I would recommend this to be added to anyone's baby registry.
customer_reviews.author: addsnhere

customer_reviews.title: Very good but and buying again
customer_reviews.text: This has been a good buy and am definitely gonna buy again. We did not fix it on top of a changing table or dresser instead put it on a bed/floor as needed. 10 month old does not try to go out of it as much due to the sides being slightly raised. After using for nearly 9 months, we felt that it is better to replace it. For cleaning it down we wiped it with soap and sometimes with diluted bleach.
customer_reviews.author: Nash

customer_reviews.title: Great, but recommend no-skid underneath pad
customer_reviews.text: Bought this changing pad for our changing table in our infants room. The material is easy to clean (even though we have a cover on it most of the time) and is water proof. This pad also has a safety buckle you can easily use when changing the baby. This pad sits on a wooden changing table in our home. The bottom of this pad is slippery and moves around on the table. I would recommend a no-skid underneath this pad for safety.
customer_reviews.author: Mackenzie

customer_reviews.title: Soft, sturdy and easy to clean
customer_reviews.text: Super comfortable and soft as well as easy to clean. I was hestitant about buying this product as I wasn’t sure if I needed it but Glad we finally did. We first started changing my daughter on a roll out mat in random places but it wasn’t too comfortable my husband also had issues bending down to change her as it was hurting his back. We purchased this and put it on the sinks space in the bathroom and it’s worked great. It’s also very easy to clean although we also bought sheets for it as it can get a bit cold.
customer_reviews.author: Luisa F. Cardona

customer_reviews.title: Great replacement
customer_reviews.text: We finally replaced the pad that comes with the changing table as the sheets we bought for it were basically bending it in half as the pad wasn't big enough. This one fits those perfectly. It's also nice to know it provides a little safety if our baby rolls one way or the other. I'm sure its much more comfortable too. Would buy again!!
customer_reviews.author: LexMark

customer_reviews.title: Baby Must Have
customer_reviews.text: This changing pad is at a great price point and has worked well for seven months and counting. It fit our dresser top well and the anchor strap is great for safety. We haven't needed the buckle as much as our baby isn't into rolling, but it's still a good size for her. We use a changing pad liner on top with a cover to save on staining and that has worked perfectly
customer_reviews.author: Maureen

customer_reviews.title: My baby loves this changing pad!
customer_reviews.text: I have to rewrite my review on this. I just figured it was an average changing pad. I’m still not sure what’s so great about it, but my baby loves to lay on it! She doesn’t care for her rock n play, bouncer, boppy lounger, etc. but for some strange reason she just loves to lay on this pad and roll to her sides and coo. I guess it’s just really comfy to her for whatever reason. That said, the pad is decent for the price and so far has served its purpose and beyond.
customer_reviews.author: heather cerigioni

customer_reviews.title: Good Pad, Funky Smell ...
customer_reviews.text: This pad is the perfect size for our changing table topper, is very lightweight and made of pretty durable materials. I do agree with some of the other reviewers that when the item arrived, it had a funky/nasty smell to it that also permeated the box. The actual pad aired out, but we immediately took the box and wrapping outside of our house, it was that strong. I wiped the pad down with a Chlorox wipe and let it air out in the bathroom before putting it in the baby’s room. Other than that, so far so good for the price!
customer_reviews.author: Jaime_Ranay

customer_reviews.title: good value
customer_reviews.text: This is a good changing pad. We’ve had it for a couple years now and it’s held up well. I clean it with antibacterial wipes so it’s not like I’m gentle with it and it looks pretty much the same as it did when we bought it. I do keep a cover on it when it’s in use. It’s been an excellent value for the amount of use we’ve gotten out of it. I like that it’s inexpensive enough that I don’t mind giving it away and repurchasing for the next baby rather than have it add to the pile of baby items being saved as hand me downs.
customer_reviews.author: Liz

customer_reviews.title: great for younger babies
customer_reviews.text: We used this from newborn to around 7 months old. We loved sleeping with our daughter between us, and this was great to help protect her from us rolling over, or even coming too close. (were both gentle sleepers and don't roll much) Its comfortable for her when we used a soft blanket on top of it, and she always slept very well. We highly recommend this!!!
customer_reviews.author: Thomas Kuhlman

customer_reviews.title: Good quality
customer_reviews.text: This has worked well for us so far. I haven't had very many instances where I've had to clean it (thankfully), so I can't review much on that. The couple of times where pee has gotten through the cover and onto it, it hasn't soaked through the mat and I've been able to easily wipe it up. It seems comfy for my baby and it fits great on the changing table.
customer_reviews.author: Rachelle

customer_reviews.title: Love this!
customer_reviews.text: I use to nanny and my first family that I cared for use this in the living room. I found this interesting because I only associated it with a changing table. Well I ordered this and it has been a relief of traveling upstairs to change the baby. If we are doing tummy time and it’s time to change him I just reach for this. It’s comfortable, easy to clean, transport and water (liquid) resistant. Great buy!
customer_reviews.author: Lauren H.

customer_reviews.title: Second one
customer_reviews.text: I purchases a second one when the first finally died after being used for several children (I am on my fourth...and last!). Didn't want to buy another one for just one more kid but it made such a good cheap purchase the first time it was an easy decision to get a new clean one for the last kiddo.
customer_reviews.author: Braedon Goudie

customer_reviews.title: We love it, baby loves it
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely love it. I will say it’s much bigger than I had imagined so be sure and check the measurement details so you won’t be surprised by that. It’s good that it’s big so it can be used longer. We were just thinking about bringing it in a suitcase when we travel, but I don’t think it will fit. Our son loves it when we lay him down on this. It has contoured edges and little straps so we can run off and grab something real quick and not worry (as much) that he will roll off the table.
customer_reviews.author: April

customer_reviews.title: Great changing pad
customer_reviews.text: Great changing pad. I have 2 of these, one for the changing table in the nursery and one that I use on the floor downstairs. They have both maintained their shape. They are soft for baby to lay on, but do not sink in. I use a changing pad cover so I haven't experienced an accident on the pad itself, but it is made of a material that I would imagine would not absorb and wipe clean with ease. I would recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Saholmz

customer_reviews.title: Perfect product for a perfect price
customer_reviews.text: Although we have yet to use it since our twins aren’t due for a few more months this product on the outside looks awesome! We got it for much cheaper than anywhere else is offering changing pads and the changing liners and pad cover fit perfectly on it. It is also much larger than I thought! We have a home made changing table that is made to be extra big to accommodate two babies and this pad definitely fits right in perfectly!
customer_reviews.author: Leigha

customer_reviews.title: Could be 5 stars if...
customer_reviews.text: I really enjoy using this changing pad, buy it could use a few improvements. The bottom of the changing pad does not have a non-slip grip as advertised. The pad has these small dimpled circles in it that "stuff" gets trapped in and can make it a little more difficult to clean. And last but not least, the bottom is not completely waterproof because of the opening. That makes it a little more challenging to give it a good hose down after a messy diaper change.
customer_reviews.author: D-Lo

customer_reviews.title: Very high quality
customer_reviews.text: This was the second changing pad that I purchased back with my first child. The first one was awful and I regretted not spending just a little extra and buying this one from the beginning. It's easy to find covers that fit this pad and the quality is superior. I am now using it with my second child and it still looks brand new! It fits really nicely in my standard-sized changing table.
customer_reviews.author: Emily

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable and easy to clean
customer_reviews.text: I got this for my son's bath. I use this to shampoo my son's hair after his oatmeal baths due to hiseczema. Because of his eczema i do not wash his hair while he is in the bath just to make sure shampoo doesnt get on his body (just incase he breaks out) this is great because this is soft and waterproof so i put it on the sink counter and just put him on top of this changing pad while I hold his head! Its safe for the baby and convenient for me!
customer_reviews.author: K. Ha

customer_reviews.title: - Inexpensive - Comfortable enough (serta one more comfortable but not enough for ...
customer_reviews.text: Pros: - Inexpensive - Comfortable enough (serta one more comfortable but not enough for the price difference) - Regular covers fit. I use these:  - Easy to clean Cons: - Slips on dresser but I use this and it doesn't move at all. Just stuck two to the bottom.
customer_reviews.author: Kristin Davison

customer_reviews.title: Don’t make my mistake and check measurements
customer_reviews.text: It might be my fault for assuming changing pads have some sort of standard size. I bought a second changing table for upstairs in my home and this pad was supposed to be for that changing table but it was way to long for it. So I guess I’d advise be smarter than me and check the measurements ;) The item itself is great I just wished it wasn’t that long
customer_reviews.author: Katarina

customer_reviews.title: Great changing table cushion
customer_reviews.text: I bought two of these , because both my younger children had babies within a month of each other ! Both moms loved the changing table cushion. Make sure it fits the table you have. It is not absorbent ! It is a soft vinyl cover that is easy to wipe down and does not retain odors.Everyone was very happy!
customer_reviews.author: Yanna B.

customer_reviews.title: You probably need one
customer_reviews.text: Go ahead an buy this. It turns any piece of furniture into a changing table. If you are looking at the reviews then you probably need it so just go ahead and buy it. I secured it to the top of a standing chest with the included strap and its been there for a year and been used countless times.
customer_reviews.author: I. Joseph Marguliath

customer_reviews.title: Not bad
customer_reviews.text: We bought second one for our kid overall it feels like life is not more than 2 years there are small dots in which baby poops and other stuff parks itself and cleaning is little difficult but I guess there is no alternative to this . Overall keep replacing after year or year and half and there won’t be any problem.
customer_reviews.author: ashutosh

customer_reviews.title: Great changing pad!
customer_reviews.text: First time mom here and love this changing pad! We don’t put a changing cover on the top because it’s annoying to change when a speck of something gets on the fabric. It’s firm yet soft enough to keep my baby safe yet comfortable. When my baby pees, the pad doesn’t absorb the pee a lot. I do take a burp cloth and press into the pad to pick more liquid up though. My only con is that it’s a bit tricky to screw into the wall if you don’t one of those securing things for the top of the dresser. Once we got it screwed into the wall, it works great!
customer_reviews.author: Haley Brumfield

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely Perfect! Very comfy and durable. This does not come with any cover- those you will need to buy- but is standard sizing and will fit on most changing tables and accommodate most covers. I found that it is stiff enough for the baby to stay in place, but comfy enough that it doesn't feel like they are laying on a bunch of rocks or just a board. Overall very happy with this! There is no need to spend a ton of money when this is available
customer_reviews.author: CourtneyE

customer_reviews.title: Check the size first
customer_reviews.text: Ordered the wrong size the first time around, but got that quickly sorted. Turned out our chat ging table would accommodate the longer size. Love the halfpipe design, really keeps the baby centered. The strap is also handy but I rarely us it. Also soft with a nice waterproof cover even though I use another washable one on top just to make it easier to clean .
customer_reviews.author: Ni518079

customer_reviews.title: Glad I bought it
customer_reviews.text: I was initially hesitant to spend money on a changing pad. But eventually felt the need for it. Now we are so glad that we bought this. Its soft, washable and the contoured edges ensure the baby will not roll over. Very happy with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: itschethz

customer_reviews.title: Sizing might be unusual for picking sheets and changing tables
customer_reviews.text: Used with Ely and Co. Sheets on the Dream on Me Emily changing table. The sheets are a little too small and the table is a little too big, about an inch of space on either side. But the cushion is great, exactly as pictured and seems very durable and I don't regret purchasing. I don't know if it's maybe not the standard size for a changing pad but in the end all of my things fit good enough to keep them all together so it should be fine.
customer_reviews.author: Rogan

customer_reviews.title: Just wipe down
customer_reviews.text: Super easy to clean! All you have to do is use a wipe when your baby decides to have a blowout on the changing table (well maybe several wipes)
customer_reviews.author: Brittany Sussman

customer_reviews.title: Soft
customer_reviews.text: We are currently at 9 months of use and it is starting to crack. Sometimes when 'stuff' gets on it the little holds where the pattern are scare us into thinking maybe the 'stuff' got into the pad. No odd smells yet. My biggets concern is the plastic or coating cracking and allowing the pad to get nasty.
customer_reviews.author: Dustin R.

customer_reviews.title: Yes!!! Get it
customer_reviews.text: Love it! Just got it so can’t attest to the longevity but seems like great quality and like the thickness of it, the straps are nice or can be hidden if you don’t need or want. Covers from same brand fit and look great on it (haven’t tried any other brands yet). For sure recommend especially for the value
customer_reviews.author: Jake Bartel

customer_reviews.title: The early diaper changes were easy but now that baby is on the move it ...
customer_reviews.text: We didn't start using a designated changing pad - diaper changing area until baby turned 9 months. The early diaper changes were easy but now that baby is on the move it is difficult to change his diaper. This changing pad is a life saver. I bought 2 - one for home and one for the babysitters. Once I place him in the changer with the buckle he stops moving and let's us change his diaper. The quality is good and he even falls asleep in it from time to time.
customer_reviews.author: stephyyy g

customer_reviews.title: A great product!
customer_reviews.text: I love this changing pad! Firstly, it’s extremely affordable & secondly, it’s a great size! I have a few changing pad covers that I was gifted recently & they fit perfectly on this pad. It looks so good on my new dresser and I couldn’t be happier! I’m so happy my husband & I decided on this changing pad for our new baby who is due end of January 2019! Love this & highly recommend to fellow Mommas & Daddy’s!
customer_reviews.author: Carrrrrieb

customer_reviews.title: So useful.
customer_reviews.text: Love it. I use this ALL the time to always create a safe place to put my baby. I have 2 of these placed in opposite places of the house to make changing my baby more convenient, I've taken it traveling to always have a clean place to change my baby so I don't get poo or pee on surfaces at friends houses, and sometimes I just use it to have a safe place with raised edges to place my baby, and of course it fits perfectly in my changing table.
customer_reviews.author: Didgeridoo

customer_reviews.title: Serves its purpose as a changing pad
customer_reviews.text: Definitely not a “non slide” or grip surface on bottom. Had to screw the provided safety tag onto the back of the dresser to make sure the pad doesn’t go sliding off the table. Good quality and what I would expect for a changing pad! Not super thick or plush but it gets the job done!
customer_reviews.author: Laura

customer_reviews.title: Great find!
customer_reviews.text: I had a 30 dollar changing pad in my baby registry, but it wasn't going to ship from anywhere to 1-2 months so I ended up going with this one. Glad I did, cause it works well and is easy to clean! Fit the changing table just right as well.
customer_reviews.author: MSH

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: Perfect changing pad but my problem is with the size box and the way it shipped. It was in a box that came up to my chest I am 5'7" so this box was at least 5' tall I would say and it was alone in the box huge oversized packaging.
customer_reviews.author: k.ann

customer_reviews.title: Perfect!
customer_reviews.text: Great product. Upgraded from a very used and very old handmade cushion piece that has been used since I was a baby, (30 years old!) In is in pretty great condition, surprisingly, yet it was time. Love the curved edges and it is super easy to clean, with a quick wipe! Also love the idea of the straps if you need or what them, they’re there. Fit perfectly on my changing table.
customer_reviews.author: Ashley

customer_reviews.title: Works Perfectly
customer_reviews.text: My review: very easy to clean and have not had any issue with "debris" getting trapped in the holes. Doesn't slide around too much My kid's review: the buckle is the best chew toy and a great distractor during diaper changes
customer_reviews.author: M9772

customer_reviews.title: Considering so many changing pads are pretty darn expensive
customer_reviews.text: Considering so many changing pads are pretty darn expensive, I love that this one is super affordable and I can't really tell the difference from the other more expensive versions on the market. The fabric is kinda plastic-y feeling, so it doesn't absorb any grossness that might occur during diaper changes and it wipes clean. I like the safety strap feature for extra peace of mind when dealing with a wiggly baby. Mine didn't have a weird chemical smell at all, so not sure what the other reviewers are talking about there....maybe I just got lucky or they changed materials since then. Overall, I think it's a great value.
customer_reviews.author: kirsty220

customer_reviews.title: Huge changing pad. Very soft
customer_reviews.text: I'm not sure how changing pads look or how big they are suppose to be but this thing is huge Material looks like it is easy to wipe down The cushion is very soft Came in a box inside of a box .. very secure. I am putting this with the corner changing table. I hope this fits. Will update when I recieve the changing table. Overall happy with my purchase it's big very wide very soft and easy clean material 5 stars.
customer_reviews.author: queen

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: This works great, I hadn’t owned a changing pad until now, this is my 4th and I’m really glad I bought this. Also my friend gave me the idea to use this like a doc-a-tot (which are pricey) she suggested bringing it to other areas of my house when I needed to lay the baby down but didn’t want to lay him on the floor.
customer_reviews.author: Scott Page

customer_reviews.title: Great deal compared to in-store prices
customer_reviews.text: Completely satisfied with this product. Fits my changing table and the standard size changing pad cover I have from Cloud Island by Target. The seams will trap debris so I recommend some kind of easily removable, washable cover for this. Even simple burp cloths or Gerber pre-fold cloth diapers work great to place baby on so you can wash any messes and to keep baby warm, because placing baby directly onto this plastic pad can be shockingly cold to baby’s skin. This is a great price compared to the same product in a big box store like Target.
customer_reviews.author: Devon

customer_reviews.title: Gets the job done
customer_reviews.text: I've been shopping around to find the best price and this by far beats any price I've found at different stores. The changing pad has all the straps for safety! UPDATE: the product is a little to light I've found that it slips around to much because its so light weight. I took away two stars due to this, but I still find this product "okay" and it still gets the job done. Hope this was helpful
customer_reviews.author: KJ

customer_reviews.title: Seems nice so far
customer_reviews.text: Bought a Burt’s Bees changing pad cover to go with this and it fits it perfectly. My sister also gave us those Munchkin washable changing pads that she never used for her kids. The munchkin pads are small—they really only cover the middle portion of this changing pad—but that’s all you really needfor the butt area.
customer_reviews.author: Callie

customer_reviews.title: Bulky
customer_reviews.text: The product serves its purpose but is very long and bulky. I do like that the pads wipeable but the little quilted patterns make so that liquids and other things can get into the crevices if the baby leaks or has an accident. Overall, I found the size and shape to be awkward.
customer_reviews.author: Amanda

customer_reviews.title: Great product!
customer_reviews.text: This worked perfect with the changing table I purchased (I’m sure it fits almost all changing tables since the top is pretty much the same size!) it’s actually thicker than the one that came with my changing table and seems comfy for baby! It has straps for those babies who love to wiggle while being changed!
customer_reviews.author: Chacha123

customer_reviews.title: Can use for up to 2 year old child
customer_reviews.text: My baby is barely 3 months old so she is too little for this huge changing pad (at least 35 inches long) at the moment but I use it as a mattress for her to sleep in bed with me sometimes and it works perfect. Amazon sells sheets for its size so I have a couple of those as well. Easy to clean and the sides of it come upward so that infant doesn’t roll off. Highly recommended
customer_reviews.author: MoniceSharde

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: I haven’t gotten to use it yet- baby isn’t due until December but Mama is nesting! It came in on time, seems pretty soft & looks to be made with the right type of material for easy clean up! It fits right on my dresser for the Mamas that don’t want to get an actual ‘changing table’.
customer_reviews.author: JandDWeb

customer_reviews.title: Surprisingly perfect for changing colostomy bags!
customer_reviews.text: My baby has a colostomy, and the firmness of this pad is soo perfect for keeping him in one place (he can't roll yet, this thing isn't a miracle worker!) Changing the bag is tough, but this makes it a bit simpler, and when I bought it I didn't even know I'd be doing more than changing simple diapers! It's long and wide enough that I can set all my supplies out around him, but curved enough that he stays in the middle. I love it!
customer_reviews.author: Samantha D

customer_reviews.title: Needs more grip
customer_reviews.text: Have not used this product yet as I am still waiting for my baby to arrive but I do have to say that there is barely any grip on the bottom of the pad. It does come with a strap to nail to the base of whatever item you place the pad on, but I am pregnant and cannot move the dresser myself to nail that strap. I expected more grip. Now I have to figure out what to add so it won’t slip off
customer_reviews.author: dlu

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: This is a great pad, our baby loves it she hangs out in it sometimes and coos and hums. The pad is easy to clean and does not absorb pee, trust me our baby has tested it to the fullest.
customer_reviews.author: Garg

product_meta.title: Summer Contoured Changing Pad
product_meta.description: Color:2 Sided ContourKeep baby comfortable and secure with the Summer Infant Contoured Changing Pad. The high curved sides and attached safety belt keep your infant securely in place and prevent baby from falling. A security strap to keeps the changing pad attached to the changing table.
feature_bullets: Durable quilted vinyl is 100% waterproof material that can be wiped clean with a damp cloth
Contoured walls and quick release safety belt keep baby comfortably and securely on pad
Security strap underneath keeps pad attached to furniture
16" x 32" changing pad fits most standard changing pad tables
Non skid bottom. Quilted, double layered PEVA vinyl is durable and easy to clean

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.8 out of 5 stars13,139 ratings4.8 out of 5 stars
specifications.Domestic Shipping: Item can be shipped within U.S.
specifications.International Shipping: This item can be shipped to select countries outside of the U.S. Learn More
